content:
I would like to bring to your attention, this useful plugin.
We can have a conversation or make comments within the OpenCPN wiki that are only visible to admins and managers. Managers are "Editors" just use the nodisplay syntax

<nodisp> your text here </nodisp>

<nodisp>
your text here
etc
</nodisp>

See https://www.dokuwiki.org/plugin:nodisp
We should probably start using this now.

It works. I added it here to hide the second Options > Charts > Vector "Safety Depth Setting" paragraph and as a normal user you will not see this paragraph, only my FIXME comment outside that.
This example may be fleeting, but here is the page https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:set_options:charts:vector_charts

We can use this to HIDE --> nodisp certain paragraphs throughout the document, which are being worked on, or there is some question about, or we can use it to discuss something, and normal users will not see it.
